title: Personally I think Toy Caldwell of The Marshall Tucker Band was & always will be a great guitarist. How does he stack up against the other greats? Why don't I ever hear his name mentioned in articles about leading guitar players? - Quora

response.answer_text: He seems to be a very solid player, indeed. But a lot of people associate great guitar playing with ‘guitar-olympics’ style soloing, unfortunately. So people like Richie Havens and Toy Caldwell aren’t crazy enough with their solos…even though they are great players in rhythm and style (except Havens is really a great rhythm player and not a soloist that I’ve ever seen). To be put on a pedestal, a player has to go way above and beyond, and/or just get the right press, and some of them work their careers that way, while others just want to be in a band, recognition for their craft or not. Them’s my thotz…cheers!
